intro: Erica scoparia subsp. maderincola, commonly known as the Madericola heath, is a shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and rocky habitats. It is well adapted to coastal and maritime climates, tolerating salt spray and strong winds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
